"@boz":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a93b6636872454e7b0100#post_537a93b6636872454e7b0100
I remember saving school projects on floppies. Back when CDs were the norm.

I've even seen
!http://4040ad.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/08/8-inch-floppy.jpg!
these, in my classrooms' 'educational' game computers.

I never knew that these were largely phased out by the time I came into existence.

topics.body:
"@boz":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a960f6368721372f10400#post_537a960f6368721372f10400
So do I in a laptop but I never bother to use it. One thing I will say for ancient tech is that it seems to be made very well; CPU's from over a decode ago work fine and CPU's made today seem to drop like flies. It's not just the CPU's either, it seems most everything in a consumer-grade PC nowadays breaks easily. When I build my next system I think I'm going to use server/workstation parts, they are built for pros and are made to be reliable and used very hard constantly.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

topics.body:
"@Shadow_the_Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/537a9a9e6368721b30a10200#post_537a9a9e6368721b30a10200
Thinking of buying an Intel xeon 1275 v3 over a Core I7 4770. They are about the same price and they are basically the same CPU but the Xeon is better in that it's made better and has ECC and a few pro features enables that make it chew through things like rendering and photoshop. Also I think it has a 5 year warranty as opposed to the 3 year in the I7.
topics.author: 5010fa077f123b1e4f00104e

[bq="trashboat"]Tell me guys, Why Should I watch Big O? For All I know, Most of Its praise could just stem from the fact that the people who praise it aren't hardcore mecha fans (Like Evangelion)[/bq]
The main character has is so classy that you feel as though if you were to walk into the same room as him that everything would turn grayscale and smooth jazz would start playing in the background while he starts a internal monologue.

topics.body:
You know speaking of mass media I realized why there's so many terrible tv shows; a lot of tv shows, movies, manga, anime and so forth start out with pretty good premise, but forget they actually have to make it happen.

What I mean by this is let's look at michael bay films; the premise for the movies he makes sounds fine, they sound interesting on paper, but when you go into the movie theatres he neither picks good actors, nor gives them good lines to read; instead all of the budget goes towards explosions!(tm)

Unfortunately far too many shows and so forth come out with amazing ideas, but they completely shit the bed when it comes to time to actually producing it.

!http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/523/175/d2f.jpg!
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
